results.title: WeChat, Wild Rumors and All, Is Their Lifeline. Washington May End That.

results.title: Soraya Santiago Solla, Transgender Trailblazer, Dies at 72
results.abstract: She was the first in Puerto Rico to change a gender designation on a birth certificate and the first there to reveal that she’d had sex-reassignment surgery.

multimedia.caption: Soraya Santiago Solla appearing in “Mala Mala,” a 2014 documentary film about the transgender community in Puerto Rico. She left the island for New York as a teenager, telling her sister, “I’m leaving, I can’t continue with this.”
multimedia.copyright: Mala Mala

results.title: Audubon Park, From Hinterlands to Urban Density
results.abstract: The ornithologist-painter John James Audubon took flight from Lower Manhattan to escape its ‘pestilential vapors.’ He landed in the picturesque woodland of the future Washington Heights, changing its landscape forever.

multimedia.caption: The Trinity Church Cemetery and Mausoleum, where the wildlife painter John James Audubon is buried (looking north). The wall at rear is at West 155th Street, the southern margin of the 14 acres of woodland to which Audubon moved his family in 1842.

results.title: N.Y.C.’s School Testing Plan May Miss Large Outbreaks, Study Finds
results.abstract: Half of New York’s students should be tested every two weeks, researchers estimate. Officials plan to test only 10 to 20 percent of each school every month.
results.byline: By Benedict Carey, James Glanz and Eliza Shapiro
